description: From Middle English ydropik, ydropyk, from Old French ydropique, from Latin hydropicus, from Ancient Greek ὑδρωπικός (hudrōpikós), from ὕδρωψ (húdrōps).

adjectives.description: hydropic (comparative more hydropic, superlative most hydropic)

entries.meaning: Dropsical; pertaining to or suffering from dropsy (edema).

examples: The worlds whole sap is sunke: / The generall balme th'hydroptique earth hath drunk […].

entries.meaning: Swollen with water; characterized by swelling and accumulation of fluid.
(biology, of an egg) Having a yolk deficiency.
